title.narrative: 1.3 DIARRHOEA AND PNEUMONIA PREVENTION

description.narrative: 1.3 By 2016, coverage and quality of high impact interventions, including provision of Essential Medicines, to address diarrheoa and pneumonia sustained in 94 counties, with emphasis on low coverage areas among U5 children (boys and girls).(FA 1&OT-06).2011 - 2013: By 2015, increased coverage and quality of ri clinic based services for diarrhoea and pneumonia prevention & treatment with emphasis on population groups with low coverage levels (compared to national average) (FA -1 & OT-06).

Immunization supply chain, including cold chain

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.3 By 2016, coverage and quality of high impact interventions, including provision of Essential Medicines, to address diarrheoa and pneumonia sustained in 94 counties, with emphasis on low coverage areas among U5 children (boys and girls).(FA 1&OT-06).2011 - 2013: By 2015, increased coverage and quality of ri clinic based services for diarrhoea and pneumonia prevention & treatment with emphasis on population groups with low coverage levels (compared to national average) (FA -1 & OT-06).

description.narrative: UNICEF supported implementation of cIMNCI (i.e. pneumonia and diarrhoea) through capacity-building and provision of essential medicines for treatment of pneumonia in 94 counties (700,000 U5 children) and ORS for treatment of diarrhoea nationwide (1.7 million U5 children). | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2017

title.narrative: Community Health Workers trained to implement integrated community case management (% of actually trained against the planned)
Percentage of <5 children with suspected pneumonia treated with antibiotics.
Percentage of <5 children with diarrhoea received ORS
Proportion of children aged 6-59 months fully covered with 2 doses of vitamin A in the last year.
Primary Health Care facilities providing clinical care to children under five using the IMNCI approach

actual.value: 2017:PHC facilities in 16 counties providing clinical care using IMNCI approach
